title: Shell History
content:
What history is

Your shell records previously executed commands. This improves speed and repeatability.

Basic usage

  • Up/Down arrows: browse history
  • history: list recent commands
  • Ctrl+R: reverse search (type part of a command)
history | tail

Re-running commands

!!        # repeat last command
!42       # repeat command number 42 (if supported)

Be careful with history expansion. Prefer copying and editing commands before re-running, especially destructive ones like rm.
